question: Question_01_(n)
statement:
Short-Answer Questions. Put your answer in the box provided but show
your work also. Each question is worth 3 marks, but not all questions
are of equal difficulty.

Find the expected value of the random variable $X$ whose probability
density function is

\[\displaystyle f(x) = \frac{2}{9\sqrt[3]{x}}, \quad 1 \le x \le 4.\]
sols:
The expected value of a random variable $X$ with probability density
function $f(x)$, which we denote by $\mathbb{E}[X]$, is given by :

\[\mathbb{E}[X] = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty}xf(x)\,dx.\] In this case, the
expected value is given by

\begin{align*}
\mathbb{E}[X] &= \int_{1}^{4}x\left(\frac{2}{9\sqrt[3]{x}}\right)\,dx = \frac{2}{9}\int_{1}^{4} x^{2/3}\,dx \\
&= \frac{2}{9}\left(\frac{3}{5}x^{5/3}\right)\Big\vert_{1}^{4} = \frac{2}{15}\left(4^{5/3} - 1\right).
\end{align*} Therefore,

\[{\color{blue}\mathbb{E}[X] = \frac{2}{15}\left(4^{5/3} -1\right)}.\]
